title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.60 - Executive Order No. 60: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the Counties of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson and St. Lawrence and Contiguous Areas. [**][DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.60 - Executive Order No. 60: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the Counties of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson and St. Lawrence and Contiguous Areas. [**][DAGGER]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on January 7, 1998, a severe storm
system with a combination of rain, freezing rain, and ice caused widespread
power outages and disrupted vital transportation and public safety systems in
the counties of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, and St. Lawrence; and
WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which the affected
local governments are unable to respond adequately; therefore, pursuant to the
authority vested in me by the Constitution of the State of New York and Section
28 of Article 2-B of the Executive Law, I hereby declare a disaster emergency, effective January 7, 1998, within the territorial boundaries of the counties of

Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson and St. Lawrence and their contiguous
areas; FURTHER, pursuant to Section 29 of Article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness Plan
and authorize, effective January 7, 1998, the State Emergency Management

Office, the State Department of Transportation, the State Police, the State

Division of Military and Naval Affairs, the State Department of Environmental

Conservation, the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation, the

State Department of Correctional Services, the Public Service Commission and
other State agencies as necessary to take appropriate actions to assist those
affected counties in restoring vital public transportation systems and to
provide such other assistance as necessary to protect the public health and
safety; and
FURTHER, I have designated Edward F. Jacoby, Jr., Director
of the State Emergency Management Office, as the State Coordinating Officer for
this disaster emergency. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: January 8, 1998

Executive Order No. 60.1
[DAGGER]
[DOUBLE DAGGER]
*
Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the Counties of

Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, St. Lawrence, Lewis and Contiguous

Areas. WHEREAS, beginning on January 7, 1998, a severe storm
system with a combination of rain, freezing rain, and ice caused widespread
power outages and disrupted vital transportation and public safety systems in
the counties of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, St. Lawrence and Lewis; and
WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which the affected
local governments are unable to respond adequately; therefore, pursuant to the
authority vested in me by the Constitution of the State of New York and Section
28 of Article 2-B of the Executive Law, I hereby declare a disaster emergency, effective January 7, 1998, within the territorial boundaries of the counties of

Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, St. Lawrence and Lewis and their
contiguous areas; FURTHER, pursuant to Section 29 of Article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness Plan
and authorize, effective January 7, 1998, the State Emergency Management

Office, the State Department of Transportation, the State Police, the State

Division of Military and Naval Affairs, the State Department of Environmental

Conservation, the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation, the

State Department of Correctional Services, the Public Service Commission and
other State agencies as necessary to take appropriate actions to assist those
affected counties in restoring vital public transportation systems and to
provide such other assistance as necessary to protect the public health and
safety; and
FURTHER, I have designated Edward F. Jacoby, Jr., Director
of the State Emergency Management Office, as the State Coordinating Officer for
this disaster emergency. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: January 10, 1998

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
